basic.description:
Introduction to cultural and social theory of film and other media as it relates to the tension between citizenship and consumerism. Examines roles, functions, and impact of mass media technologies, institutions, and practices in both scholarly and practical forms.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;24Lb;24O;36P)
basic.subject: FILM
basic.title: Media and Cultural Studies

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite  (A grade of B- in FILM 110) or (a GPA of 2.60 in FILM 104 and FILM 106) or (a GPA of 2.60 in BISC100 and FILM104) and (reg. in a FILM Plan, STSC or the Computer-Film (COFI) Specialization Plan).
